title: Ikea's instructions for building the best pillow forts are what every parent needs right now
description: After what feels like a lifetime in quarantine and isolation, parents may be running out of ideas to keep kids entertained.

title: Mary-Kate Olsen files for divorce from Olivier Sarkozy, emergency petition denied
description: Mary-Kate Olsen has filed for divorce from her husband of almost five years, Olivier Sarkozy.

title: Questions surround Mexico's reported Covid-19 death toll
description: Mexico has announced plans to reopen the country even as the reported number of coronavirus cases and deaths have been called into question. CNN's Matt Rivers reports

title: Denmark's Noma restaurant turns into burger bar
Will audiences go back to movie theaters after the pandemic ends?
description: More and more movies once destined for the big screen are going on-demand while theaters are closed due to the pandemic. Here's what will and will not change about moviegoing because of Covid-19.

title: What used to be a 5-hour trip now takes an entire day. This is why
description: A location-tracking wristband, mandatory testing upon arrival, one-time hotel entry key cards. CNN's Will Ripley shows us Hong Kong's new strict protocols for travelers arriving from abroad.

title: Protesters harass local reporter during a reopening rally
description: News 12 Long Island reporter Kevin Vesey was covering a reopening when protesters harassed and insulted him, and some invaded his personal space while refusing to wear a mask.

title: The striking difference between Trump and Fauci at briefing
description: President Donald Trump explains why his medical experts are wearing masks but he is not at a White House coronavirus briefing.

title: Edvard Munch's masterpiece The Scream is fading. New research has found out why
description: Over the last few decades, an unseen enemy has been degrading The Scream. The famous painting by Edvard Munch represents human anxiety and anguish and feels especially relevant during these uncertain times.

title: German soccer returns but not as we know it
description: It's an experiment and the stakes couldn't be higher.

title: Prestigious British flower show goes virtual
description: Horticultural enthusiasts will be able to take a virtual tour of award-winning designers' gardens when Britain's famous Chelsea Flower Show goes online later this month for the first time in its history.

title: Trump repeats his goal of developing a vaccine before the end of the year, a timeline experts call highly ambitious
Trump unveils new vaccine effort
description: President Donald Trump, whose prediction of a coronavirus vaccine by year's end outpaces the outlook given by most health officials, will unveil the two men leading his "Operation Warp Speed" development effort during a noon event in the Rose Garden on Friday.

title: China is mobilizing its global media machine in the coronavirus war of words
description: The story of the coronavirus pandemic can be complicated and hard to follow, from how it started to the measures countries have taken to tackle its spread.

title: Apple just gave the world a glimpse at its future
description: Apple has come a long way from its origins as a small-time PC maker for hobbyists. But one thing has remained remarkably consistent about Apple over the past 44 years: It's been stuck in two dimensions.

title: How China is trying to control the Covid-19 narrative
description: The narrative around the coronavirus can be complicated. Now experts say governments are deliberately deepening the confusion.

title: The Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards are the laugh we need right now
description: We could all use a laugh right now. Thankfully, the natural world has answered our prayers for a bit of respite from the daily doom and gloom.

title: David Crosby, sperm donor, responds to death of Melissa Etheridge's son
description: Legendary singer David Crosby helped fellow singer Melissa Etheridge's son Beckett Cypher be conceived and now Crosby is speaking out about his death.

title: Cafe tells customers to wear pool noodles to enforce social distancing
description: A cafe in Germany has celebrated its grand reopening to customers after lockdown by handing out pool noodles to maintain social distancing.

title: The focus is shifting from trying to eliminate coronavirus to reducing the risks, a doctor says
description: The US appears to be changing its strategy from trying to completely eliminate coronavirus to reducing infection risks as the nation reopens, a health expert says.

title: Hawaii discourages tourists from visiting through at least the end of June
description: If you were planning on an early summer vacation in Hawaii this year, the state's governor hopes you think twice.

title: Remote destinations for luxurious isolation
description: While the future of travel remains unclear in a new coronavirus world, travel industry experts say that one trend is likely to ring true: an interest in remote destinations where social distancing is a way of life rather than a concerted effort.

title: Trump is appealing to Americans who have lost jobs, not lives. And it may work
Despite warnings and no proof, some countries turn to herbal tonic to try to treat Covid-19
description: Even as global health authorities warn of potential dangers and misinformation about an untested natural therapy, the leader of one African country is pushing a traditional tonic to try to treat coronavirus patients across the continent.

title: Dear Grandma, read this before you visit the little ones
description: Dear Grandma,

title: Quarantine bringing out creativity for millions on TikTok
description: CNN's Max Foster shows how people are creatively using TikTok to lip-sync and dance their way out of boredom during the coronavirus lockdown.

title: House to vote on $3 trillion Covid aid package and historic rules change to allow remote voting
description: The House of Representatives will vote on Friday on a Covid-19 aid package with a price tag of more than $3 trillion and a historic rules change to allow lawmakers to vote remotely during the pandemic.

title: How an iconic Las Vegas casino plans to conquer Covid-19
description: At the heart of a nearly vacant Las Vegas Strip, Caesar's iconic palace stands empty.

title: Man alone at sea for 3 months emerges to a changed world
description: After spending months alone at sea, Canadian sailor Bill Norrie arrived in Christchurch, New Zealand, to find the world completely changed by the coronavirus pandemic. CNN affiliate TVNZ reports.

title: For 200 years, these villagers lived 2,600 feet up a remote cliff. Now they're in a housing estate
description: Villagers living up a remote 800-meter (2,624-foot) clifftop in southwest China that became famous for the precarious ladders connecting it to the world have been moved to a new urban housing estate.

title: 'Beating hearts' of these pulsating stars create music to astronomers' ears
description: Stars may appear bright to us on Earth, but peering inside their hearts is a little more elusive. Star data from NASA's planet-hunting TESS mission has helped an international team of scientists detect patterns in 60 pulsating stars.

title: This store owner has crammed 12,000 house plants into her home to keep business afloat lockdown
description: When 29-year-old Kerri Notman closed her plant and gift store just before the coronavirus lockdown, she didn't expect to spend the next two months surrounded by 12,000 plants in her own home as she fought to keep her business afloat online during the pandemic.

title: Why this chef keeps showing up at disaster zones
description: Award-winning chef José Andrés is no stranger to disaster zones.

title: Baby elephant born at the Houston Zoo survives emergency surgery
description: It's a boy!

title: Trump is appealing to Americans who have lost jobs not lives. And it may work.
Why some ultra-Orthodox Jewish communities defy social distancing
description: The Israeli government knew to expect trouble on Tuesday night. It was Lag Ba-Omer, a Jewish holiday traditionally celebrated in Israel with mass gatherings around roaring bonfires. For the devout ultra-Orthodox community, it is an occasion for making a pilgrimage to Mt. Meron in the country's north, where the second-century Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai is buried.

title: Europe's top three economies are now in recession. The real shock is still to come
description: Germany's economy shrank at the fastest pace since the global financial crisis in the first three months of the year, with GDP contracting by 2.2% compared to the previous quarter.

title: Trump is winning on the economy. That may not matter
description: The US economy is contracting. Jobs have been shed at a record pace during the coronavirus pandemic. Normally, a president would be blamed for the bad economy, and his economic and overall approval ratings would be declining at a rapid pace.

title: Spanish island: Germans can start visiting in June
description: Spain's Mallorca island in the Mediterranean plans to welcome a limited number of Germans and other travelers in late June in a "pilot project" to restart tourism that has been halted due to coronavirus, Francina Armengol, the Regional President of the Balearic Islands said Thursday.

title: Don't be a jerk during a global pandemic
description: Enforcing social distancing isn't easy, even when you're simply trying to serve people ice cream.

title: Life after lockdown in Vietnam: This is what it's like when an entire country reopens
description: As the faint smell of smoke rose up from the sidewalk and into my bedroom, I jumped up and stepped out onto the balcony to survey the Hanoi streets.

title: Border town caught in bizarre, uneven lockdown
description: Like so many small business owners, Monic van der Krogt has been hit hard by the coronavirus. The terrace of her cafe and beer garden in this small Belgian town sits empty.

title: Amazon files lawsuit over 'widespread tech support fraud' targeting Alexa users
description: Amazon is accusing two companies of "widespread tech support fraud" targeting users of its Alexa virtual assistant and smart speakers.

title: Meet the scientist working on a radical new vaccine
description: Scientists in London are working to develop a radical new type of vaccine in the effort to combat Covid-19. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

title: Trapped in lockdown, she was stabbed in the eye
description: Seconds after Veronica opened her eyes in the hospital, she knew who had put her there. Her body ached; her head throbbed.

title: Former federal judge who brought down the 'Teflon Don' steps into Flynn case
description: Nearly three decades ago, John Gleeson made his name by successfully prosecuting the man known as "The Teflon Don."

title: Katy Perry strips off to reveal her baby bump in new 'Daisies' video
description: Katy Perry has released a dreamy music video ahead of her newest studio album -- and in it, she strips off to reveal her nude baby bump.

title: My friends bailed on our vacation, and it was the best trip of my life
description: Sara hated the idea of leaving her boyfriend. Katie got a summer job. Maria didn't think she could afford it after all.

title: Tens of thousands of Singapore's migrant workers are infected. The rest are stuck in their dorms as the country opens up
description: At the start of April, Singapore had about 1,000 cases of the novel coronavirus.

title: Anderson Cooper claps back at Trump Jr. over Thunberg 'drama'
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper addresses the online criticism surrounding teen climate activist Greta Thunberg's appearance on a CNN coronavirus town hall.

title: Here's what's going on in your kids' minds
description: The welfare of children and the impact of their prolonged absence from school is quickly turning into a flashpoint of the Covid-19 shutdown. Why? As we've written, workers can't go back until schools reopen, which means the economy can't get back to normal until schools reopen.

title: US military sends very public message to China as tensions rise in South China Sea
McConnell admits he was wrong to say Obama administration failed to leave a pandemic playbook
description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell conceded Thursday night that he was wrong to claim that the Obama administration had not left behind a plan to deal with a pandemic in the US.

title: Mom makes a wild contraption so grandma can hug kids
description: Kids hug grandma through plastic. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on a hugging contraption.

title: This iconic casino's never locked it doors. Until now.
description: CNN's Kyung Lah speaks with the CEO of Caesars Entertainment Tony Rodio about how the pandemic has halted operations at the iconic Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, and how the hotel and casino plans to reopen once restrictions are eased.
